member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.RXE
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 RXE message segment. This segment has the following fields:
RXE-1: Quantity / timing (TQ)
RXE-2: Give Code (CE)
RXE-3: Give Amount - Minimum (NM)
RXE-4: Give Amount - Maximum (NM)
RXE-5: Give Units (CE)
RXE-6: Give Dosage Form (CE)
RXE-7: Provider's Administration Instructions (CE)
RXE-8: Deliver-to location (CM_LA1)
RXE-9: Substitution Status (ID)
RXE-10: Dispense Amount (NM)
RXE-11: Dispense Units (CE)
RXE-12: Number of Refills (NM)
RXE-13: Ordering Provider's DEA Number (CN_PERSON)
RXE-14: Pharmacist Verifier ID (CN_PERSON)
RXE-15: Prescription Number (ST)
RXE-16: Number of Refills Remaining (NM)
RXE-17: Number of refills / doses dispensed (NM)
RXE-18: Date / time of most recent refill or dose dispensed (TS)
RXE-19: Total Daily Dose (CQ_QUANTITY)
RXE-20: Needs Human Review (ID)
RXE-21: Pharmacy Special Dispensing Instructions (CE)
RXE-22: Give Per (Time Unit) (ST)
RXE-23: Give Rate Amount (CE)
RXE-24: Give Rate Units (CE)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

members.member: Creates a RXE (PHARMACY ENCODED ORDER) segment object that belongs to the given message.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.PV2
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 PV2 message segment. This segment has the following fields:
PV2-1: Prior Pending Location (CM_INTERNAL_LOCATION)
PV2-2: Accommodation Code (CE)
PV2-3: Admit Reason (CE)
PV2-4: Transfer Reason (CE)
PV2-5: Patient Valuables (ST)
PV2-6: Patient Valuables Location (ST)
PV2-7: Visit User Code (ID)
PV2-8: Expected Admit Date (DT)
PV2-9: Expected Discharge Date (DT)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

member.summary:
Represents an HL7 PRA message segment. This segment has the following fields:
PRA-1: PRA - primary key value (ST)
PRA-2: Practitioner group (CE)
PRA-3: Practitioner Category (ID)
PRA-4: Provider Billing (ID)
PRA-5: Specialty (CM_SPD)
PRA-6: Practitioner ID Numbers (CM_PLN)
PRA-7: Privileges (CM_PIP)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.IN1
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 IN1 message segment. This segment has the following fields:
IN1-1: Set ID - insurance (SI)
IN1-2: Insurance plan ID (ID)
IN1-3: Insurance company ID (ST)
IN1-4: Insurance company name (ST)
IN1-5: Insurance company address (AD)
IN1-6: Insurance company contact pers (PN)
IN1-7: Insurance company phone number (TN)
IN1-8: Group number (ST)
IN1-9: Group name (ST)
IN1-10: Insured's group employer ID (ST)
IN1-11: Insured's group employer name (ST)
IN1-12: Plan effective date (DT)
IN1-13: Plan expiration date (DT)
IN1-14: Authorization information (CM_AUI)
IN1-15: Plan type (ID)
IN1-16: Name of insured (PN)
IN1-17: Insured's relationship to patient (ID)
IN1-18: Insured's date of birth (DT)
IN1-19: Insured's address (AD)
IN1-20: Assignment of benefits (ID)
IN1-21: Coordination of benefits (ID)
IN1-22: Coordination of benefits - priority (ST)
IN1-23: Notice of admission code (ID)
IN1-24: Notice of admission date (DT)
IN1-25: Report of eligibility code (ID)
IN1-26: Report of eligibility date (DT)
IN1-27: Release information code (ID)
IN1-28: Pre-admit certification (PAC) (ST)
IN1-29: Verification date / time (TS)
IN1-30: Verification by (CN_PERSON)
IN1-31: Type of agreement code (ID)
IN1-32: Billing status (ID)
IN1-33: Lifetime reserve days (NM)
IN1-34: Delay before lifetime reserve days (NM)
IN1-35: Company plan code (ID)
IN1-36: Policy number (ST)
IN1-37: Policy deductible (NM)
IN1-38: Policy limit - amount (NM)
IN1-39: Policy limit - days (NM)
IN1-40: Room rate - semi-private (NM)
IN1-41: Room rate - private (NM)
IN1-42: Insured's employment status (CE)
IN1-43: Insured's sex (ID)
IN1-44: Insured's employer address (AD)
IN1-45: Verification status (ST)
IN1-46: Prior insurance plan ID (ID)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Message.NMQ_N02
member.summary:
Represents a NMQ_N02 message structure (see chapter [AAA]). This structure contains the following elements:
0: MSH (MESSAGE HEADER)
1: NMQ_N02_QRY_WITH_DETAIL (a Group object) optional
2: NMQ_N02_CLOCK_AND_STATISTICS (a Group object) repeating

member.summary: Creates a new NMQ_N02 Group with custom IModelClassFactory.

member.summary: Creates a new NMQ_N02 Group with DefaultModelClassFactory.

member.summary: initalize method for NMQ_N02. This does the segment setup for the message.

member.summary: Returns first repetition of NMQ_N02_CLOCK_AND_STATISTICS (a Group object) - creates it if necessary

member.summary:
Represents a MFK_M02 message structure (see chapter [AAA]). This structure contains the following elements:
0: MSH (MESSAGE HEADER)
1: MSA (MESSAGE ACKNOWLEDGMENT)
2: ERR (ERROR) optional
3: MFI (MASTER FILE IDENTIFICATION)
4: MFA (MASTER FILE ACKNOWLEDGEMENT) optional repeating

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.RXD
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 RXD message segment. This segment has the following fields:
RXD-1: Dispense Sub-ID Counter (NM)
RXD-2: Dispense / give code (CE)
RXD-3: Date / time dispensed (TS)
RXD-4: Actual Dispense Amount (NM)
RXD-5: Actual Dispense Units (CE)
RXD-6: Actual Dosage Form (CE)
RXD-7: Prescription Number (ST)
RXD-8: Number of Refills Remaining (NM)
RXD-9: Dispense Notes (ST)
RXD-10: Dispensing Provider (CN_PERSON)
RXD-11: Substitution Status (ID)
RXD-12: Total Daily Dose (CQ_QUANTITY)
RXD-13: Deliver-to location (CM_LA1)
RXD-14: Needs Human Review (ID)
RXD-15: Pharmacy Special Dispensing Instructions (CE)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

members.member: Creates a RXD (PHARMACY DISPENSE) segment object that belongs to the given message.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.PV1
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 PV1 message segment. This segment has the following fields:
PV1-1: Set ID - Patient Visit (SI)
PV1-2: Patient Class (ID)
PV1-3: Assigned Patient Location (CM_INTERNAL_LOCATION)
PV1-4: Admission Type (ID)
PV1-5: Preadmit Number (ST)
PV1-6: Prior Patient Location (CM_INTERNAL_LOCATION)
PV1-7: Attending Doctor (CN_PHYSICIAN)
PV1-8: Referring Doctor (CN_PHYSICIAN)
PV1-9: Consulting Doctor (CN_PHYSICIAN)
PV1-10: Hospital Service (ID)
PV1-11: Temporary Location (CM_INTERNAL_LOCATION)
PV1-12: Preadmit Test Indicator (ID)
PV1-13: Readmission indicator (ID)
PV1-14: Admit Source (ID)
PV1-15: Ambulatory Status (ID)
PV1-16: VIP Indicator (ID)
PV1-17: Admitting Doctor (CN_PHYSICIAN)
PV1-18: Patient type (ID)
PV1-19: Visit Number (CM_PAT_ID)
PV1-20: Financial Class (CM_FINANCE)
PV1-21: Charge Price Indicator (ID)
PV1-22: Courtesy Code (ID)
PV1-23: Credit Rating (ID)
PV1-24: Contract Code (ID)
PV1-25: Contract Effective Date (DT)
PV1-26: Contract Amount (NM)
PV1-27: Contract Period (NM)
PV1-28: Interest Code (ID)
PV1-29: Transfer to bad debt - code (ID)
PV1-30: Transfer to bad debt - date (DT)
PV1-31: Bad Debt Agency Code (ID)
PV1-32: Bad Debt Transfer Amount (NM)
PV1-33: Bad Debt Recovery Amount (NM)
PV1-34: Delete Account Indicator (ID)
PV1-35: Delete Account Date (DT)
PV1-36: Discharge Disposition (ID)
PV1-37: Discharged to Location (CM_DLD)
PV1-38: Diet Type (ID)
PV1-39: Servicing Facility (ID)
PV1-40: Bed Status (ID)
PV1-41: Account Status (ID)
PV1-42: Pending Location (CM_INTERNAL_LOCATION)
PV1-43: Prior Temporary Location (CM_INTERNAL_LOCATION)
PV1-44: Admit date / time (TS)
PV1-45: Discharge date / time (TS)
PV1-46: Current Patient Balance (NM)
PV1-47: Total Charges (NM)
PV1-48: Total Adjustments (NM)
PV1-49: Total Payments (NM)
PV1-50: Alternate Visit ID (CM_PAT_ID_0192)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.NST
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 NST message segment. This segment has the following fields:
NST-1: Statistics Available (ID)
NST-2: Source Identifier (ST)
NST-3: Source Type (ID)
NST-4: Statistics Start (TS)
NST-5: Statistics End (TS)
NST-6: Receive Character Count (NM)
NST-7: Send Character Count (NM)
NST-8: Message Received (NM)
NST-9: Message Sent (NM)
NST-10: Checksum Errors Received (NM)
NST-11: Length Errors Received (NM)
NST-12: Other Errors Received (NM)
NST-13: Connect Timeouts (NM)
NST-14: Receive Timeouts (NM)
NST-15: Network Errors (NM)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

members.member: Creates a NST (Statistics) segment object that belongs to the given message.

member.summary: Returns Receive Character Count(NST-6).

Represents an HL7 NSC message segment. This segment has the following fields:
NSC-1: Network Change Type (ID)
NSC-2: Current CPU (ST)

NSC-4: Current Application (ST)
NSC-5: Current Facility (ST)
NSC-6: New CPU (ST)

The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

member.summary:
Represents a ADT_A31 message structure (see chapter [AAA]). This structure contains the following elements:
0: MSH (MESSAGE HEADER)
1: EVN (EVENT TYPE)
2: PID (PATIENT IDENTIFICATION)
3: NK1 (NEXT OF KIN) optional repeating
4: PV1 (PATIENT VISIT)
5: PV2 (PATIENT VISIT - additional information) optional
6: OBX (OBSERVATION RESULT) optional repeating
7: AL1 (PATIENT ALLERGY INFORMATION) optional repeating
8: DG1 (DIAGNOSIS) optional repeating
9: PR1 (PROCEDURES) optional repeating
10: GT1 (GUARANTOR) optional repeating
11: ADT_A31_INSURANCE (a Group object) optional repeating
12: ACC (ACCIDENT) optional
13: UB1 (UB82 DATA) optional
14: UB2 (UB92 DATA) optional

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Group.ARD_A19_QUERY_RESPONSE
member.summary:
Represents the ARD_A19_QUERY_RESPONSE Group. A Group is an ordered collection of message segments that can repeat together or be optionally in/excluded together. This Group contains the following elements:
0: EVN (EVENT TYPE) optional
1: PID (PATIENT IDENTIFICATION)
2: NK1 (NEXT OF KIN) optional repeating
3: PV1 (PATIENT VISIT)
4: PV2 (PATIENT VISIT - additional information) optional
5: OBX (OBSERVATION RESULT) optional repeating
6: AL1 (PATIENT ALLERGY INFORMATION) optional repeating
7: DG1 (DIAGNOSIS) optional repeating
8: PR1 (PROCEDURES) optional repeating
9: GT1 (GUARANTOR) optional repeating
10: ARD_A19_INSURANCE (a Group object) optional repeating
11: ACC (ACCIDENT) optional
12: UB1 (UB82 DATA) optional
13: UB2 (UB92 DATA) optional

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.RXC
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 RXC message segment. This segment has the following fields:
RXC-1: RX Component Type (ID)
RXC-2: Component Code (CE)
RXC-3: Component Amount (NM)
RXC-4: Component Units (CE)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

members.member: Creates a RXC (PHARMACY COMPONENT ORDER) segment object that belongs to the given message.

member.summary: Returns RX Component Type(RXC-1).

member.summary: Returns Component Code(RXC-2).

member.name: P:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.RXC.ComponentAmount
member.summary: Returns Component Amount(RXC-3).

member.name: P:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.RXC.ComponentUnits
member.summary: Returns Component Units(RXC-4).

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.ODT
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 ODT message segment. This segment has the following fields:
ODT-1: Tray Type (CE)
ODT-2: Service Period (CE)
ODT-3: Text Instruction (ST)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.OBR
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 OBR message segment. This segment has the following fields:
OBR-1: Set ID - Observation Request (SI)
OBR-2: Placer Order Number (CM_PLACER)
OBR-3: Filler Order Number (CM_FILLER)
OBR-4: Universal Service ID (CE)
OBR-5: Priority (not used) (ID)
OBR-6: Requested date / time (not used) (TS)
OBR-7: Observation date / time (TS)
OBR-8: Observation end date / time (TS)
OBR-9: Collection Volume (CQ_QUANTITY)
OBR-10: Collector Identifier (CN_PERSON)
OBR-11: Specimen action code (ID)
OBR-12: Danger Code (CE)
OBR-13: Relevant clinical information (ST)
OBR-14: Specimen received date / time (TS)
OBR-15: Specimen source (CM_SPS)
OBR-16: Ordering Provider (CN_PERSON)
OBR-17: Order Callback Phone Number (TN)
OBR-18: Placer field 1 (ST)
OBR-19: Placer field 2 (ST)
OBR-20: Filler Field 1 (ST)
OBR-21: Filler Field 2 (ST)
OBR-22: Results report / status change - date / time (TS)
OBR-23: Charge to Practice (CM_MOC)
OBR-24: Diagnostic service section ID (ID)
OBR-25: Result Status (ID)
OBR-26: Parent Result (CM_PARENT_RESULT)
OBR-27: Quantity / timing (TQ)
OBR-28: Result Copies To (CN_PERSON)
OBR-29: Parent Number (CM_EIP)
OBR-30: Transportation Mode (ID)
OBR-31: Reason for Study (CE)
OBR-32: Principal Result Interpreter (CM_NDL)
OBR-33: Assistant Result Interpreter (CM_NDL)
OBR-34: Technician (CM_NDL)
OBR-35: Transcriptionist (CM_NDL)
OBR-36: Scheduled date / time (TS)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

members.member: Creates a OBR (OBSERVATION REQUEST) segment object that belongs to the given message.

member.summary: Returns a single repetition of Collector Identifier(OBR-10). throws HL7Exception if the repetition number is invalid. The repetition number (this is a repeating field)

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.EVN
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 EVN message segment. This segment has the following fields:
EVN-1: Event Type Code (ID)
EVN-2: Date / time of event (TS)
EVN-3: Date / time planned event (TS)
EVN-4: Event Reason Code (ID)
EVN-5: Operator ID (ID)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

members.member: Creates a EVN (EVENT TYPE) segment object that belongs to the given message.

member.name: P:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.EVN.EventTypeCode
member.summary: Returns Event Type Code(EVN-1).

member.name: P:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.EVN.DateTimeOfEvent
member.summary: Returns Date / time of event(EVN-2).

member.name: P:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.EVN.DateTimePlannedEvent
member.summary: Returns Date / time planned event(EVN-3).

member.name: P:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.EVN.EventReasonCode
member.summary: Returns Event Reason Code(EVN-4).

member.name: P:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.EVN.OperatorID
member.summary: Returns Operator ID(EVN-5).

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.BLG
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 BLG message segment. This segment has the following fields:
BLG-1: When to Charge (CM_CCD)
BLG-2: Charge Type (ID)
BLG-3: Account ID (CK_ACCOUNT_NO)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

members.member: Creates a BLG (BILLING) segment object that belongs to the given message.

member.name: P:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.BLG.WhenToCharge
member.summary: Returns When to Charge(BLG-1).

member.name: P:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.BLG.ChargeType
member.summary: Returns Charge Type(BLG-2).

member.name: P:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.BLG.AccountID
member.summary: Returns Account ID(BLG-3).

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Group.BAR_P01_VISIT
member.summary:
Represents the BAR_P01_VISIT Group. A Group is an ordered collection of message segments that can repeat together or be optionally in/excluded together. This Group contains the following elements:
0: PV1 (PATIENT VISIT) optional
1: PV2 (PATIENT VISIT - additional information) optional
2: OBX (OBSERVATION RESULT) optional repeating
3: AL1 (PATIENT ALLERGY INFORMATION) optional repeating
4: DG1 (DIAGNOSIS) optional repeating
5: PR1 (PROCEDURES) optional repeating
6: GT1 (GUARANTOR) optional repeating
7: NK1 (NEXT OF KIN) optional repeating
8: BAR_P01_INSURANCE (a Group object) optional repeating
9: ACC (ACCIDENT) optional
10: UB1 (UB82 DATA) optional

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.ODS
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 ODS message segment. This segment has the following fields:
ODS-1: Type (ID)
ODS-2: Service Period (CE)
ODS-3: Diet, Supplement, or Preference Code (CE)
ODS-4: Text Instruction (ST)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.MFE
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 MFE message segment. This segment has the following fields:
MFE-1: Record-level event code (ID)
MFE-2: MFN control ID (ST)
MFE-3: Effective date / time (TS)
MFE-4: Primary key value (CE)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.PID
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 PID message segment. This segment has the following fields:
PID-1: Set ID - Patient ID (SI)
PID-2: Patient ID (External ID) (CK_PAT_ID)
PID-3: Patient ID (Internal ID) (CM_PAT_ID)
PID-4: Alternate Patient ID (ST)
PID-5: Patient Name (PN)
PID-6: Mother's Maiden Name (ST)
PID-7: Date of Birth (TS)
PID-8: Sex (ID)
PID-9: Patient Alias (PN)
PID-10: Race (ID)
PID-11: Patient Address (AD)
PID-12: County code (ID)
PID-13: Phone Number - Home (TN)
PID-14: Phone Number - Business (TN)
PID-15: Language - Patient (ST)
PID-16: Marital Status (ID)
PID-17: Religion (ID)
PID-18: Patient Account Number (CK_PAT_ID)
PID-19: Social security number - patient (ST)
PID-20: Driver's license number - patient (CM_LICENSE_NO)
PID-21: Mother's Identifier (CK_PAT_ID)
PID-22: Ethnic Group (ID)
PID-23: Birth Place (ST)
PID-24: Multiple Birth Indicator (ID)
PID-25: Birth Order (NM)
PID-26: Citizenship (ID)
PID-27: Veterans Military Status (ST)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.OM5
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 OM5 message segment. This segment has the following fields:
OM5-1: Segment Type ID (ST)
OM5-2: Sequence Number - Test/ Observation Master File (NM)
OM5-3: Tests / observations included within an ordered test battery (CE)
OM5-4: Observation ID Suffixes (ST)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

members.member: Creates a OM5 (OBSERVATION BATTERIES) segment object that belongs to the given message.

member.name: M:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.OM5.GetTestsObservationsIncludedWithinAnOrderedTestBattery(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a single repetition of Tests / observations included within an ordered test battery(OM5-3). throws HL7Exception if the repetition number is invalid. The repetition number (this is a repeating field)

member.name: M:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.OM5.GetTestsObservationsIncludedWithinAnOrderedTestBattery
member.summary: Returns all repetitions of Tests / observations included within an ordered test battery (OM5-3).

member.name: P:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.OM5.SegmentTypeID
member.summary: Returns Segment Type ID(OM5-1).

member.name: P:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.OM5.SequenceNumberTestObservationMasterFile
member.summary: Returns Sequence Number - Test/ Observation Master File(OM5-2).

member.name: P:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.OM5.TestsObservationsIncludedWithinAnOrderedTestBatteryRepetitionsUsed
member.summary: Returns the total repetitions of Tests / observations included within an ordered test battery (OM5-3).

member.name: P:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.OM5.ObservationIDSuffixes
member.summary: Returns Observation ID Suffixes(OM5-4).

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.AL1
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 AL1 message segment. This segment has the following fields:
AL1-1: Set ID - Allergy (SI)
AL1-2: Allergy Type (ID)
AL1-3: Allergy code / mnemonic / description (CE)
AL1-4: Allergy Severity (ID)
AL1-5: Allergy Reaction (ST)
AL1-6: Identification Date (DT)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

members.member: Creates a AL1 (PATIENT ALLERGY INFORMATION) segment object that belongs to the given message.

member.summary: Returns Set ID - Allergy(AL1-1).

member.name: P:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.AL1.AllergyType
member.summary: Returns Allergy Type(AL1-2).

member.name: P:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.AL1.AllergyCodeMnemonicDescription
member.summary: Returns Allergy code / mnemonic / description(AL1-3).

member.name: P:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.AL1.AllergySeverity
member.summary: Returns Allergy Severity(AL1-4).

member.name: P:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.AL1.AllergyReaction
member.summary: Returns Allergy Reaction(AL1-5).

member.name: P:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.AL1.IdentificationDate
member.summary: Returns Identification Date(AL1-6).

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Message.NMR_N02
member.summary:
Represents a NMR_N02 message structure (see chapter [AAA]). This structure contains the following elements:
0: MSH (MESSAGE HEADER)
1: MSA (MESSAGE ACKNOWLEDGMENT)
2: ERR (ERROR) optional
3: QRD (QUERY DEFINITION) optional
4: NMR_N02_CLOCK_AND_STATS_WITH_NOTES_ALT (a Group object) repeating

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Message.DFT_P03
member.summary:
Represents a DFT_P03 message structure (see chapter [AAA]). This structure contains the following elements:
0: MSH (MESSAGE HEADER)
1: EVN (EVENT TYPE)
2: PID (PATIENT IDENTIFICATION)
3: PV1 (PATIENT VISIT) optional
4: PV2 (PATIENT VISIT - additional information) optional
5: OBX (OBSERVATION RESULT) optional repeating
6: FT1 (FINANCIAL TRANSACTION) repeating

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Group.ORM_O01_ORDER_DETAIL
member.summary:
Represents the ORM_O01_ORDER_DETAIL Group. A Group is an ordered collection of message segments that can repeat together or be optionally in/excluded together. This Group contains the following elements:
0: OBR (OBSERVATION REQUEST)
1: RQD (REQUISITION DETAIL)
2: RQ1 (REQUISITION DETAIL-!)
3: RXO (PHARMACY PRESCRIPTION ORDER)
4: ODS (DIETARY ORDERS, SUPPLEMENTS, and PREFERENCES)
5: ODT (DIET TRAY INSTRUCTION)
6: NTE (NOTES AND COMMENTS) optional repeating
7: OBX (OBSERVATION RESULT) optional repeating
8: NTE (NOTES AND COMMENTS) repeating

Represents an HL7 Zxx message segment. This segment has the following fields:
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.RXO
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 RXO message segment. This segment has the following fields:
RXO-1: Requested Give Code (CE)
RXO-2: Requested Give Amount - Minimum (NM)
RXO-3: Requested Give Amount - Maximum (NM)
RXO-4: Requested Give Units (CE)
RXO-5: Requested Dosage Form (CE)
RXO-6: Provider's Pharmacy Instructions (CE)
RXO-7: Provider's Administration Instructions (CE)
RXO-8: Deliver-to location (CM_LA1)
RXO-9: Allow Substitutions (ID)
RXO-10: Requested Dispense Code (CE)
RXO-11: Requested Dispense Amount (NM)
RXO-12: Requested Dispense Units (CE)
RXO-13: Number of Refills (NM)
RXO-14: Ordering Provider's DEA Number (CN_PERSON)
RXO-15: Pharmacist Verifier ID (CN_PERSON)
RXO-16: Needs Human Review (ID)
RXO-17: Requested Give Per (Time Unit) (ST)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.OM4
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 OM4 message segment. This segment has the following fields:
OM4-1: Segment Type ID (ST)
OM4-2: Sequence Number - Test/ Observation Master File (NM)
OM4-3: Derived Specimen (ID)
OM4-4: Container Description (TX)
OM4-5: Container Volume (NM)
OM4-6: Container Units (CE)
OM4-7: Specimen (CE)
OM4-8: Additive (CE)
OM4-9: Preparation (TX)
OM4-10: Special Handling Requirements (TX)
OM4-11: Normal Collection Volume (CQ_QUANTITY)
OM4-12: Minimum Collection Volume (CQ_QUANTITY)
OM4-13: Specimen Requirements (TX)
OM4-14: Specimen Priorities (ID)
OM4-15: Specimen Retention Time (CQ_QUANTITY)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.OM3
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 OM3 message segment. This segment has the following fields:
OM3-1: Segment Type ID (ST)
OM3-2: Sequence Number - Test/ Observation Master File (NM)
OM3-3: Preferred Coding System (ID)
OM3-4: Valid coded answers (CE)
OM3-5: Normal test codes for categorical observations (CE)
OM3-6: Abnormal test codes for categorical observations (CE)
OM3-7: Critical test codes for categorical observations (CE)
OM3-8: Data Type (ID)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.MFA
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 MFA message segment. This segment has the following fields:
MFA-1: Record-level event code (ID)
MFA-2: MFN control ID (ST)
MFA-3: Event completion date / time (TS)
MFA-4: Error return code and/or text (CE)
MFA-5: Primary key value (CE)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

members.member: Creates a MFA (MASTER FILE ACKNOWLEDGEMENT) segment object that belongs to the given message.

member.summary: Returns a single repetition of Primary key value(MFA-5). throws HL7Exception if the repetition number is invalid. The repetition number (this is a repeating field)

member.name: M:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.MFA.GetPrimaryKeyValue
member.summary: Returns all repetitions of Primary key value (MFA-5).

member.summary: Returns Record-level event code(MFA-1).

member.summary: Returns MFN control ID(MFA-2).

member.name: P:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.MFA.EventCompletionDateTime
member.summary: Returns Event completion date / time(MFA-3).

member.summary: Returns Error return code and/or text(MFA-4).

member.summary: Returns the total repetitions of Primary key value (MFA-5).

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.GT1
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 GT1 message segment. This segment has the following fields:
GT1-1: Set ID - guarantor (SI)
GT1-2: Guarantor number (CK)
GT1-3: Guarantor name (PN)
GT1-4: Guarantor spouse name (PN)
GT1-5: Guarantor address (AD)
GT1-6: Guarantor phone number - home (TN)
GT1-7: Guarantor phone number - business (TN)
GT1-8: Guarantor date of birth (DT)
GT1-9: Guarantor sex (ID)
GT1-10: Guarantor type (ID)
GT1-11: Guarantor relationship (ID)
GT1-12: Guarantor social security number (ST)
GT1-13: Guarantor date - begin (DT)
GT1-14: Guarantor date - end (DT)
GT1-15: Guarantor priority (NM)
GT1-16: Guarantor employer name (ST)
GT1-17: Guarantor employer address (AD)
GT1-18: Guarantor employ phone number (TN)
GT1-19: Guarantor employee ID number (ST)
GT1-20: Guarantor employment status (ID)
GT1-21: Guarantor organization (ST)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

members.member: Creates a GT1 (GUARANTOR) segment object that belongs to the given message.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Message.ADT_A08
member.summary:
Represents a ADT_A08 message structure (see chapter [AAA]). This structure contains the following elements:
0: MSH (MESSAGE HEADER)
1: EVN (EVENT TYPE)
2: PID (PATIENT IDENTIFICATION)
3: NK1 (NEXT OF KIN) optional repeating
4: PV1 (PATIENT VISIT)
5: PV2 (PATIENT VISIT - additional information) optional
6: OBX (OBSERVATION RESULT) optional repeating
7: AL1 (PATIENT ALLERGY INFORMATION) optional repeating
8: DG1 (DIAGNOSIS) optional repeating
9: PR1 (PROCEDURES) optional repeating
10: GT1 (GUARANTOR) optional repeating
11: ADT_A08_INSURANCE (a Group object) optional repeating
12: ACC (ACCIDENT) optional
13: UB1 (UB82 DATA) optional
14: UB2 (UB92 DATA) optional

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.URD
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 URD message segment. This segment has the following fields:
URD-1: R/U date / time (TS)
URD-2: Report Priority (ID)
URD-3: R/U Who Subject Definition (ST)
URD-4: R/U What Subject Definition (ID)
URD-5: R/U What Department Code (ST)
URD-6: R/U display / print locations (ST)
URD-7: R/U Results Level (ID)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.UB2
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 UB2 message segment. This segment has the following fields:
UB2-1: Set ID - UB92 (SI)
UB2-2: Co-insurance days (9) (ST)
UB2-3: Condition code (24-30) (ID)
UB2-4: Covered days (7) (ST)
UB2-5: Non-covered days (8) (ST)
UB2-6: Value amount and code (39-41) (CM_UVC)
UB2-7: Occurrence code and date (32-35) (CM_OCD)
UB2-8: Occurrence span code / dates (36) (CM_OSP)
UB2-9: UB92 locator 2 (state) (ST)
UB2-10: UB92 locator 11 (state) (ST)
UB2-11: UB92 locator 31 (national) (ST)
UB2-12: Document control number (37) (ST)
UB2-13: UB92 locator 49 (national) (ST)
UB2-14: UB92 locator 56 (state) (ST)
UB2-15: UB92 locator 57 (national) (ST)
UB2-16: UB92 Locator 78 (state) (ST)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.OM2
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 OM2 message segment. This segment has the following fields:
OM2-1: Segment Type ID (ST)
OM2-2: Sequence Number - Test/ Observation Master File (NM)
OM2-3: Units of Measure (CE)
OM2-4: Range of Decimal Precision (NM)
OM2-5: Corresponding SI Units of Measure (CE)
OM2-6: SI Conversion Factor (TX)
OM2-7: Reference (normal) range - ordinal and continuous observations (CM_RFR)
OM2-8: Critical range for ordinal and continuous observations (CM_RANGE)
OM2-9: Absolute range for ordinal and continuous observations (CM_ABS_RANGE)
OM2-10: Delta Check Criteria (CM_DLT)
OM2-11: Minimum Meaningful Increments (NM)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.FT1
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 FT1 message segment. This segment has the following fields:
FT1-1: Set ID - financial transaction (SI)
FT1-2: Transaction ID (ST)
FT1-3: Transaction batch ID (ST)
FT1-4: Transaction date (DT)
FT1-5: Transaction posting date (DT)
FT1-6: Transaction type (ID)
FT1-7: Transaction code (CE)
FT1-8: Transaction description (ST)
FT1-9: Transaction description - alternate (ST)
FT1-10: Transaction quantity (NM)
FT1-11: Transaction amount - extended (NM)
FT1-12: Transaction amount - unit (NM)
FT1-13: Department code (CE)
FT1-14: Insurance plan ID (ID)
FT1-15: Insurance amount (NM)
FT1-16: Assigned Patient Location (CM_INTERNAL_LOCATION)
FT1-17: Fee schedule (ID)
FT1-18: Patient type (ID)
FT1-19: Diagnosis code (CE)
FT1-20: Performed by code (CN_PERSON)
FT1-21: Ordered by code (CN_PERSON)
FT1-22: Unit cost (NM)
FT1-23: Filler Order Number (CM_FILLER)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Message.ADT_A07
member.summary:
Represents a ADT_A07 message structure (see chapter [AAA]). This structure contains the following elements:
0: MSH (MESSAGE HEADER)
1: EVN (EVENT TYPE)
2: PID (PATIENT IDENTIFICATION)
3: MRG (MERGE PATIENT INFORMATION) optional
4: NK1 (NEXT OF KIN) optional repeating
5: PV1 (PATIENT VISIT)
6: PV2 (PATIENT VISIT - additional information) optional
7: OBX (OBSERVATION RESULT) optional repeating
8: AL1 (PATIENT ALLERGY INFORMATION) optional repeating
9: DG1 (DIAGNOSIS) optional repeating
10: PR1 (PROCEDURES) optional repeating
11: GT1 (GUARANTOR) optional repeating
12: ADT_A07_INSURANCE (a Group object) optional repeating
13: ACC (ACCIDENT) optional
14: UB1 (UB82 DATA) optional
15: UB2 (UB92 DATA) optional

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.UB1
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 UB1 message segment. This segment has the following fields:
UB1-1: Set ID - UB82 (SI)
UB1-2: Blood deductible (43) (NM)
UB1-3: Blood furnished pints of (40) (NM)
UB1-4: Blood replaced pints (41) (NM)
UB1-5: Blood not replaced pints (42) (NM)
UB1-6: Co-insurance days (25) (NM)
UB1-7: Condition code (35-39) (ID)
UB1-8: Covered days (23) (NM)
UB1-9: Non-covered days (24) (NM)
UB1-10: Value amount and code (46-49) (CM_UVC)
UB1-11: Number of grace days (90) (NM)
UB1-12: Special program indicator (44) (ID)
UB1-13: PSRO / UR approval indicator (87) (ID)
UB1-14: PSRO / UR approved stay - from (88) (DT)
UB1-15: PSRO / UR approved stay - to (89) (DT)
UB1-16: Occurrence (28-32) (CM_OCD)
UB1-17: Occurrence span (33) (ID)
UB1-18: Occurrence span start date (33) (DT)
UB1-19: Occurrence span end date (33) (DT)
UB1-20: UB-82 locator 2 (ST)
UB1-21: UB-82 locator 9 (ST)
UB1-22: UB-82 locator 27 (ST)
UB1-23: UB-82 locator 45 (ST)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

members.member: Creates a UB1 (UB82 DATA) segment object that belongs to the given message.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.OM1
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 OM1 message segment. This segment has the following fields:
OM1-1: Segment Type ID (ST)
OM1-2: Sequence Number - Test/ Observation Master File (NM)
OM1-3: Producer's test / observation ID (CE)
OM1-4: Permitted Data Types (ID)
OM1-5: Specimen Required (ID)
OM1-6: Producer ID (CE)
OM1-7: Observation Description (TX)
OM1-8: Other test / observation IDs for the observation (CE)
OM1-9: Other Names (ST)
OM1-10: Preferred Report Name for the Observation (ST)
OM1-11: Preferred Short Name or Mnemonic for Observation (ST)
OM1-12: Preferred Long Name for the Observation (ST)
OM1-13: Orderability (ID)
OM1-14: Identity of instrument used to perform this study (CE)
OM1-15: Coded Representation of Method (CE)
OM1-16: Portable (ID)
OM1-17: Observation producing department / section (ID)
OM1-18: Telephone Number of Section (TN)
OM1-19: Nature of test / observation (ID)
OM1-20: Report Subheader (CE)
OM1-21: Report Display Order (ST)
OM1-22: Date / time stamp for any change in definition for obs (TS)
OM1-23: Effective date / time of change (TS)
OM1-24: Typical Turn-around Time (NM)
OM1-25: Processing Time (NM)
OM1-26: Processing Priority (ID)
OM1-27: Reporting Priority (ID)
OM1-28: Outside Site(s) Where Observation may be Performed (CE)
OM1-29: Address of Outside Site(s) (AD)
OM1-30: Phone Number of Outside Site (TN)
OM1-31: Confidentiality Code (ID)
OM1-32: Observations required to interpret the observation (CE)
OM1-33: Interpretation of Observations (TX)
OM1-34: Contraindications to Observations (CE)
OM1-35: Reflex tests / observations (CE)
OM1-36: Rules that Trigger Reflex Testing (ST)
OM1-37: Fixed Canned Message (CE)
OM1-38: Patient Preparation (TX)
OM1-39: Procedure Medication (CE)
OM1-40: Factors that may affect the observation (TX)
OM1-41: Test / observation performance schedule (ST)
OM1-42: Description of Test Methods (TX)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

members.member: Creates a OM1 (GENERAL - fields that apply to most observations) segment object that belongs to the given message.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Message.QRY_Q01
member.summary:
Represents a QRY_Q01 message structure (see chapter [AAA]). This structure contains the following elements:
0: MSH (MESSAGE HEADER)
1: QRD (QUERY DEFINITION)
2: QRF (QUERY FILTER) optional
3: DSC (CONTINUATION POINTER) optional

member.summary: Creates a new QRY_Q01 Group with custom IModelClassFactory.

member.summary: Creates a new QRY_Q01 Group with DefaultModelClassFactory.

member.summary: initalize method for QRY_Q01. This does the segment setup for the message.

member.summary: Returns MSH (MESSAGE HEADER) - creates it if necessary

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.URS
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 URS message segment. This segment has the following fields:
URS-1: R/U Where Subject Definition (ST)
URS-2: R/U when data start date / time (TS)
URS-3: R/U when data end date / time (TS)
URS-4: R/U What User Qualifier (ST)
URS-5: R/U Other Results Subject Definition (ST)
URS-6: R/U which date / time qualifier (ID)
URS-7: R/U which date / time status qualifier (ID)
URS-8: R/U date / time selection qualifier (ID)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.STF
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 STF message segment. This segment has the following fields:
STF-1: STF - primary key value (CE)
STF-2: Staff ID Code (CE)
STF-3: Staff Name (PN)
STF-4: Staff Type (ID)
STF-5: Sex (ID)
STF-6: Date of Birth (TS)
STF-7: Active / inactive (ID)
STF-8: Department (CE)
STF-9: Service (CE)
STF-10: Phone (TN)
STF-11: Office / home address (AD)
STF-12: Activation Date (CM_DIN)
STF-13: Inactivation Date (CM_DIN)
STF-14: Backup Person ID (CE)
STF-15: E-mail Address (ST)
STF-16: Preferred method of Contact (ID)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

5: OBX (OBSERVATION RESULT) optional repeating

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Message.ADT_A05
member.summary:
Represents a ADT_A05 message structure (see chapter [AAA]). This structure contains the following elements:
0: MSH (MESSAGE HEADER)
1: EVN (EVENT TYPE)
2: PID (PATIENT IDENTIFICATION)
3: NK1 (NEXT OF KIN) optional repeating
4: PV1 (PATIENT VISIT)
5: PV2 (PATIENT VISIT - additional information) optional
6: OBX (OBSERVATION RESULT) optional repeating
7: AL1 (PATIENT ALLERGY INFORMATION) optional repeating
8: DG1 (DIAGNOSIS) optional repeating
9: PR1 (PROCEDURES) optional repeating
10: GT1 (GUARANTOR) optional repeating
11: ADT_A05_INSURANCE (a Group object) optional repeating
12: ACC (ACCIDENT) optional
13: UB1 (UB82 DATA) optional
14: UB2 (UB92 DATA) optional

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Message.ADT_A04
member.summary:
Represents a ADT_A04 message structure (see chapter [AAA]). This structure contains the following elements:
0: MSH (MESSAGE HEADER)
1: EVN (EVENT TYPE)
2: PID (PATIENT IDENTIFICATION)
3: NK1 (NEXT OF KIN) optional repeating
4: PV1 (PATIENT VISIT)
5: PV2 (PATIENT VISIT - additional information) optional
6: OBX (OBSERVATION RESULT) optional repeating
7: AL1 (PATIENT ALLERGY INFORMATION) optional repeating
8: DG1 (DIAGNOSIS) optional repeating
9: PR1 (PROCEDURES) optional repeating
10: GT1 (GUARANTOR) optional repeating
11: ADT_A04_INSURANCE (a Group object) optional repeating
12: ACC (ACCIDENT) optional
13: UB1 (UB82 DATA) optional
14: UB2 (UB92 DATA) optional

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.QRD
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 QRD message segment. This segment has the following fields:
QRD-1: Query date / time (TS)
QRD-2: Query Format Code (ID)
QRD-3: Query Priority (ID)
QRD-4: Query ID (ST)
QRD-5: Deferred Response Type (ID)
QRD-6: Deferred response date / time (TS)
QRD-7: Quantity Limited Request (CQ_QUANTITY)
QRD-8: Who Subject Filter (ST)
QRD-9: What Subject Filter (ID)
QRD-10: What Department Data Code (ST)
QRD-11: What data code value qualifier (CM_VR)
QRD-12: Query Results Level (ID)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

members.member: Creates a QRD (QUERY DEFINITION) segment object that belongs to the given message.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.OBX
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 OBX message segment. This segment has the following fields:
OBX-1: Set ID - Observational Simple (SI)
OBX-2: Value Type (ID)
OBX-3: Observation Identifier (CE)
OBX-4: Observation Sub-ID (ST)
OBX-5: Observation Value (varies)
OBX-6: Units (CE)
OBX-7: References Range (ST)
OBX-8: Abnormal Flags (ID)
OBX-9: Probability (NM)
OBX-10: Nature of Abnormal Test (ID)
OBX-11: Observation result status (ID)
OBX-12: Effective date last observation normal values (TS)
OBX-13: User Defined Access Checks (ST)
OBX-14: Date / time of the observation (TS)
OBX-15: Producer's ID (CE)
OBX-16: Responsible Observer (CN_PHYSICIAN)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

members.member: Creates a OBX (OBSERVATION RESULT) segment object that belongs to the given message.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Message.ADT_A03
member.summary:
Represents a ADT_A03 message structure (see chapter [AAA]). This structure contains the following elements:
0: MSH (MESSAGE HEADER)
1: EVN (EVENT TYPE)
2: PID (PATIENT IDENTIFICATION)
3: PV1 (PATIENT VISIT)
4: PV2 (PATIENT VISIT - additional information) optional
5: OBX (OBSERVATION RESULT) optional repeating

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.PR1
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 PR1 message segment. This segment has the following fields:
PR1-1: Set ID - procedure (SI)
PR1-2: Procedure coding method (ID)
PR1-3: Procedure code (ID)
PR1-4: Procedure description (ST)
PR1-5: Procedure date / time (TS)
PR1-6: Procedure type (ID)
PR1-7: Procedure minutes (NM)
PR1-8: Anesthesiologist (CN_PERSON)
PR1-9: Anesthesia code (ID)
PR1-10: Anesthesia minutes (NM)
PR1-11: Surgeon (CN_PERSON)
PR1-12: Procedure Practitioner (CM_PRACTITIONER)
PR1-13: Consent code (ID)
PR1-14: Procedure priority (NM)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

members.member: Creates a PR1 (PROCEDURES) segment object that belongs to the given message.

member.summary: Returns all repetitions of Procedure coding method (PR1-2).

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.MSH
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 MSH message segment. This segment has the following fields:
MSH-1: Field separator (ST)
MSH-2: Encoding characters (ST)
MSH-3: Sending application (ST)
MSH-4: Sending facility (ST)
MSH-5: Receiving application (ST)
MSH-6: Receiving facility (ST)
MSH-7: Date / Time of message (TS)
MSH-8: Security (ST)
MSH-9: Message type (CM_MSG)
MSH-10: Message Control ID (ST)
MSH-11: Processing ID (ID)
MSH-12: Version ID (ID)
MSH-13: Sequence number (NM)
MSH-14: Continuation pointer (ST)
MSH-15: Accept acknowledgement type (ID)
MSH-16: Application acknowledgement type (ID)
MSH-17: Country code (ID)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Message.ADT_A13
member.summary:
Represents a ADT_A13 message structure (see chapter [AAA]). This structure contains the following elements:
0: MSH (MESSAGE HEADER)
1: EVN (EVENT TYPE)
2: PID (PATIENT IDENTIFICATION)
3: NK1 (NEXT OF KIN) optional repeating
4: PV1 (PATIENT VISIT)
5: PV2 (PATIENT VISIT - additional information) optional
6: OBX (OBSERVATION RESULT) optional repeating
7: AL1 (PATIENT ALLERGY INFORMATION) optional repeating
8: DG1 (DIAGNOSIS) optional repeating
9: PR1 (PROCEDURES) optional repeating
10: GT1 (GUARANTOR) optional repeating
11: ADT_A13_INSURANCE (a Group object) optional repeating
12: ACC (ACCIDENT) optional
13: UB1 (UB82 DATA) optional
14: UB2 (UB92 DATA) optional

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.RXG
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 RXG message segment. This segment has the following fields:
RXG-1: Give Sub-ID Counter (NM)
RXG-2: Dispense Sub-ID Counter (NM)
RXG-3: Quantity / timing (TQ)
RXG-4: Give Code (CE)
RXG-5: Give Amount - Minimum (NM)
RXG-6: Give Amount - Maximum (NM)
RXG-7: Give Units (CE)
RXG-8: Give Dosage Form (CE)
RXG-9: Administration Notes (ST)
RXG-10: Substitution Status (ID)
RXG-11: Deliver-to location (CM_LA1)
RXG-12: Needs Human Review (ID)
RXG-13: Pharmacy Special Administration Instructions (CE)
RXG-14: Give Per (Time Unit) (ST)
RXG-15: Give Rate Amount (CE)
RXG-16: Give Rate Units (CE)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

members.member: Creates a RXG (PHARMACY GIVE) segment object that belongs to the given message.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.IN3
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 IN3 message segment. This segment has the following fields:
IN3-1: Set ID - insurance certification (SI)
IN3-2: Certification number (ST)
IN3-3: Certified by (CN_PERSON)
IN3-4: Certification required (ID)
IN3-5: Penalty (CM_PEN)
IN3-6: Certification date / time (TS)
IN3-7: Certification modify date / time (TS)
IN3-8: Operator (CN_PERSON)
IN3-9: Certification begin date (DT)
IN3-10: Certification end date (DT)
IN3-11: Days (CM_DTN)
IN3-12: Non-concur code / description (CE)
IN3-13: Non-concur effective date / time (TS)
IN3-14: Physician reviewer (CN_PERSON)
IN3-15: Certification contact (ST)
IN3-16: Certification contact phone number (TN)
IN3-17: Appeal reason (CE)
IN3-18: Certification agency (CE)
IN3-19: Certification agency phone number (TN)
IN3-20: Pre-certification required / window (CM_PCF)
IN3-21: Case manager (ST)
IN3-22: Second opinion date (DT)
IN3-23: Second opinion status (ID)
IN3-24: Second opinion documentation received (ID)
IN3-25: Second opinion practitioner (CN_PERSON)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

members.member: Creates a IN3 (INSURANCE ADDITIONAL INFO-CERTIFICATION) segment object that belongs to the given message.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.DSP
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 DSP message segment. This segment has the following fields:
DSP-1: Set ID - Display Data (SI)
DSP-2: Display Level (SI)
DSP-3: Data Line (TX)
DSP-4: Logical Break Point (ST)
DSP-5: Result ID (TX)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

members.member: Creates a DSP (DISPLAY DATA) segment object that belongs to the given message.

member.summary: Returns Logical Break Point(DSP-4).

member.name: P:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.DSP.ResultID
member.summary: Returns Result ID(DSP-5).

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.DG1
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 DG1 message segment. This segment has the following fields:
DG1-1: Set ID - diagnosis (SI)
DG1-2: Diagnosis coding method (ID)
DG1-3: Diagnosis code (ID)
DG1-4: Diagnosis description (ST)
DG1-5: Diagnosis date / time (TS)
DG1-6: Diagnosis / DRG type (ID)
DG1-7: Major diagnostic category (CE)
DG1-8: Diagnostic related group (ID)
DG1-9: DRG approval indicator (ID)
DG1-10: DRG grouper review code (ID)
DG1-11: Outlier type (ID)
DG1-12: Outlier days (NM)
DG1-13: Outlier cost (NM)
DG1-14: Grouper version and type (ST)
DG1-15: Diagnosis / DRG priority (NM)
DG1-16: Diagnosing clinician (CN_PERSON)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Message.ADT_A01
member.summary:
Represents a ADT_A01 message structure (see chapter [AAA]). This structure contains the following elements:
0: MSH (MESSAGE HEADER)
1: EVN (EVENT TYPE)
2: PID (PATIENT IDENTIFICATION)
3: NK1 (NEXT OF KIN) optional repeating
4: PV1 (PATIENT VISIT)
5: PV2 (PATIENT VISIT - additional information) optional
6: OBX (OBSERVATION RESULT) optional repeating
7: AL1 (PATIENT ALLERGY INFORMATION) optional repeating
8: DG1 (DIAGNOSIS) optional repeating
9: PR1 (PROCEDURES) optional repeating
10: GT1 (GUARANTOR) optional repeating
11: ADT_A01_INSURANCE (a Group object) optional repeating
12: ACC (ACCIDENT) optional
13: UB1 (UB82 DATA) optional
14: UB2 (UB92 DATA) optional

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.ORC
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 ORC message segment. This segment has the following fields:
ORC-1: Order Control (ID)
ORC-2: Placer Order Number (CM_PLACER)
ORC-3: Filler Order Number (CM_FILLER)
ORC-4: Placer Group Number (CM_GROUP_ID)
ORC-5: Order Status (ID)
ORC-6: Response Flag (ID)
ORC-7: Quantity / timing (TQ)
ORC-8: Parent (CM_EIP)
ORC-9: Date / time of transaction (TS)
ORC-10: Entered By (CN_PERSON)
ORC-11: Verified By (CN_PERSON)
ORC-12: Ordering Provider (CN_PERSON)
ORC-13: Enterer's Location (CM_PARENT_RESULT)
ORC-14: Call Back Phone Number (TN)
ORC-15: Order effective date / time (TS)
ORC-16: Order Control Code Reason (CE)
ORC-17: Entering Organization (CE)
ORC-18: Entering Device (CE)
ORC-19: Action by (CN_PERSON)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

members.member: Creates a ORC (COMMOM ORDER) segment object that belongs to the given message.

member.summary: Returns all repetitions of Quantity / timing (ORC-7).

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.IN2
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 IN2 message segment. This segment has the following fields:
IN2-1: Insured's employee ID (ST)
IN2-2: Insured's social security number (ST)
IN2-3: Insured's employer name (CN_PERSON)
IN2-4: Employer information data (ID)
IN2-5: Mail claim party (ID)
IN2-6: Medicare health insurance card number (NM)
IN2-7: Medicaid case name (PN)
IN2-8: Medicaid case number (NM)
IN2-9: Champus sponsor name (PN)
IN2-10: Champus ID number (NM)
IN2-11: Dependent of champus recipient (ID)
IN2-12: Champus organization (ST)
IN2-13: Champus station (ST)
IN2-14: Champus service (ID)
IN2-15: Champus rank / grade (ID)
IN2-16: Champus status (ID)
IN2-17: Champus retire date (DT)
IN2-18: Champus non-availability certification on file (ID)
IN2-19: Baby coverage (ID)
IN2-20: Combine baby bill (ID)
IN2-21: Blood deductible (NM)
IN2-22: Special coverage approval name (PN)
IN2-23: Special coverage approval title (ST)
IN2-24: Non-covered insurance code (ID)
IN2-25: Payor ID (ST)
IN2-26: Payor subscriber ID (ST)
IN2-27: Eligibility source (ID)
IN2-28: Room coverage type / amount (CM_RMC)
IN2-29: Policy type / amount (CM_PTA)
IN2-30: Daily deductible (CM_DDI)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Segment.FHS
member.summary:
Represents an HL7 FHS message segment. This segment has the following fields:
FHS-1: File Field Separator (ST)
FHS-2: File Encoding Characters (ST)
FHS-3: File Sending Application (ST)
FHS-4: File Sending Facility (ST)
FHS-5: File Receiving Application (ST)
FHS-6: File Receiving Facility (ST)
FHS-7: File creation date / time (TS)
FHS-8: File Security (ST)
FHS-9: File name / ID (ST)
FHS-10: File Header Comment (ST)
FHS-11: File Control ID (ST)
FHS-12: Reference File Control ID (ST)
The get...() methods return data from individual fields. These methods do not throw exceptions and may therefore have to handle exceptions internally. If an exception is handled internally, it is logged and null is returned. This is not expected to happen - if it does happen this indicates not so much an exceptional circumstance as a bug in the code for this class.

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Message.DSR_P04
member.summary:
Represents a DSR_P04 message structure (see chapter [AAA]). This structure contains the following elements:
0: MSH (MESSAGE HEADER)
1: MSA (MESSAGE ACKNOWLEDGMENT)
2: ERR (ERROR) optional
3: QRD (QUERY DEFINITION)
4: QRF (QUERY FILTER) optional
5: DSP (DISPLAY DATA) repeating
6: DSC (CONTINUATION POINTER) optional

member.name: T:NHapi.Model.V22.Group.ADT_A28_INSURANCE
member.summary:
Represents the ADT_A28_INSURANCE Group. A Group is an ordered collection of message segments that can repeat together or be optionally in/excluded together. This Group contains the following elements:
0: IN1 (INSURANCE)
1: IN2 (INSURANCE ADDITIONAL INFO) optional
2: IN3 (INSURANCE ADDITIONAL INFO-CERTIFICATION) optional
